column4: does anyone have a command or app that cleans ubuntu's memory? (and yes it actually is neccessary, and really is a problem)
mikechelen, my memory gets filled up by several programs, and the whole system comes to a crawl
gunthbert, thanhk you for helping me, but it IS needed. this system goes from a 4.8ghz dual core with 4 gigs of ram, to my 486 whenever i use 3 heavy hitters ram wise...
mikechelen, i do close the programs, but my memory stays full, and my system stays ridiulously slow
http://www.linuxatemyram.com/
does the music player show up as a mass storage device in Xubuntu?
some do some dont. thats why i suggested rhapsody because it "sync's" well with most players, including sansa. mine is just a big flash hard drive, so i can just drag and drop
sorry, i see rayvhen was asking
no problem. i just log in now and then to try and help people.
is rhapsody gnome only?
i don;t know. i'ver never used it.
really? it's my favorite music player for ubuntu.
nothing from Real will ever touch my system.
i goofed up not rhapsody, rhythymbox. i am such a moron.
i have messed with claws mail a while back, is claws and entire window manager or desktop environment? and if so is it based off of xfce, lxde or openbox?
dist-upgrade, or getting a new release version?
Claws uses GTK2
so claws is a wm or de? i thought it was just claws mail, which looked a little too much like sylpheed's big brother for me.
it's an e-mail client. it is built using the GTK2 ttoolkit.
ohh, i see. somehow i thought maybe it was a window manager named claws, and claws mail was part of the package, my bad.
the Claws website has all the info you need or want on the history and such of the project.
thanks!
go and see how your sensation of deja vu WRT Sylpheed is not in error. :)

have you ever had a window just up and dissappear for no reason at all? i was using update manager to do a dist-upgrade, and all of a sudden my window went poof. should have done this in cli, now i have no idea what is going on...
